meanings.sent1: The irruptions of the enemy troops caught us off guard.
meanings.sent2: The irruptions of the robbers into the village caused chaos.
meanings.sent3: The irruptions of the squirrels into the bird feeder were quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The irruptions of laughter in the serious meeting lightened the mood.
meanings.sent5: The irruptions of thunder made the storm even more frightening.

meanings.definition: A sudden increase or surge in numbers
meanings.sent1: The irruptions of customers during the sale overwhelmed the store.
meanings.sent2: The irruptions of tourists in the city during the festival were expected.
meanings.sent3: The irruptions of ants in the kitchen were not a pleasant surprise.
meanings.sent4: The irruptions of cheers from the crowd boosted the team's morale.
meanings.sent5: The irruptions of stars in the night sky were mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: A sudden and rapid spread or increase
meanings.sent1: The irruptions of rumors about the celebrity spread quickly.
meanings.sent2: The irruptions of flu cases in winter were concerning.
meanings.sent3: The irruptions of giggles in the library were unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The irruptions of colors in the painting added depth.
meanings.sent5: The irruptions of joy in her heart were undeniable.
